data.title: New variant of Manaus coronavirus strain detected in Brazil
data.description: Coronavirus experts in Brazil Wednesday admitted a new variant of the coronavirus' Manaus version had been identified, as concern about a worsening situation mounted.

data.title: Researchers in Texas Discover Antibody-Resistant Strain of Coronavirus
data.description: The potentially worrying development comes as governments worldwide have committed tens of billions of dollars to pharmaceutical companies for the development and production of vaccines to fight a virus which shut down the global economy and put much of the planet into quarantine.

data.title: Maduro Says Ready to Exchange Coronavirus Vaccines For Oil
data.description: MEXICO CITY (Sputnik) - Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro says his country is ready to pay for coronavirus vaccine deliveries with oil.

data.title: Putin Plans to Get Vaccinated Against Coronavirus Tuesday
data.description: Putin Plans to Get Vaccinated Against Coronavirus Tuesday

data.title: Kremlin: Putin Gets Vaccinated Against Coronavirus, Feeling Well
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Yesterday, the Russian leader announced he would be inoculated against the coronavirus on Tuesday. The Kremlin later clarified that the process of inoculation would not be broadcast.

data.title: Condom Sales Are Booming in US as Coronavirus Lockdowns Come to an End
data.description: The numbers look promising compared to a 4.4% drop in sales in 2020 and slow sales before the pandemic.

data.title: Iran Creates Spray Against Coronavirus, State Media Says
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Iran has unveiled its first homemade anti-COVID spray, the state-run IRNA news agency reported on Thursday.

data.title: Fire in Coronavirus Hospital Kills 10 in India's Mumbai - Reports
data.description: NEW DELHI (Sputnik) - At least ten people died and over 70 were evacuated when a fire broke out in a COVID-19 ward located on the top floor of a shopping center in India's Mumbai, local media reported on Friday.

data.title: UK Coronavirus Variant Could Be More Lethal, Study Reveals
data.description: LONDON (Sputnik) - A variant of the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 that was first identified in southeast England in September is not only highly contagious but also seems to be more lethal than other COVID-19 strains circulating in the UK, new research published on Wednesday has found.

data.title: Bashar Assad, His Wife Asma Recover From Coronavirus
data.description: The Syrian first couple tested positive for the coronavirus on 8 March after experiencing mild symptoms, going into self-isolation and continuing to perform their duties under quarantine. Syriaâ€™s Covid response has been complicated by US and European sanctions, which have restricted the delivery of even basic medical supplies during the pandemic.

data.title: Argentine Government to discuss further restrictions as coronavirus cases soar
data.description: Argentina's Cabinet Chief Santiago Cafiero and Health Minister Carla Vizzotti are to hold a meeting Monday to discuss additional measures as the spread of the coronavirus pandemic seems increasingly out of control.

data.title: US Administers Over 100 Mln Coronavirus Vaccine Doses
data.description: Currently, three vaccines against the coronavirus have been approved in the United States: Pfizer BioNTech, Moderna and Johnson & Johnson. US President Joe Biden, in a Thursday address, said that all adults in America will become eligible for the vaccination by 1 May.

data.title: Cases of South African and Indian coronavirus strains detected in Argentina
data.description: Argentine health authorities Monday reported having detected the presence of the South African and Indian strains of the coronavirus in travelers who have arrived into the country over the past few days.

data.title: Biontech Founder Says There Wonâ€™t Be Need for Coronavirus Lockdowns by Summerâ€™s End
data.description: Protests against the restrictive measures took place over the weekend in Germany as well as several other European nations, including Poland, the Netherlands, Belgium, and Finland.

data.title: Argentina: Experts advise further restrictions necessary to curb coronavirus spread
data.description: Argentine Cabinet Santiago Cafiero and Health Minister Carla Vizzotti Monday met online with a committee of experts to assess the country's current covid situation. The recommendation was, as expected, harsher restrictions.

data.title: As Coronavirus Rages in India, Deadly 'Black Fungus' Infection is on the Rise Again
data.description: Black Fungus or Mucormycosis (earlier known as zygomycosis) is a severe but rare fungal infection; it mainly affects people who have health issues or take medicines that lower the body's ability to fight germs and sickness.

data.title: California Governor Defends Coronavirus-Related Actions in Speech at Dodger Stadium
data.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has come under harsh criticism for his stringent restrictive measures and other emergency health policies during the COVID-19 pandemic. He could be deposed before his term ends due to a Recall Newsom campaign, agitating for a motion of no-confidence.

data.title: First Cases of Infection With Indian Coronavirus Strain Registered in Morocco, Algeria
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - The first cases of infection with the Indian strain of coronavirus were registered in Morocco and Algeria.

data.title: Scotland, Sturgeon and Salmond; Patel, Immigration and Refugees; and All About Coronavirus
data.description: Join George Galloway on the new home for the Mother of All Talk Shows - this week we talk about Scotland's First Minister Nicola Sturgeon, Priti Patelâ€™s new immigration plans, and all about Covid-19 and vaccines.

data.title: Sweden's Coronavirus Strategy, Immigration Darken Its Image Among Neighbours
data.description: Sweden's standalone approach to COVID-19 and its slack immigration strategy have made it somewhat of an outlier in Scandinavia. Over the past year alone, about half of survey respondents had changed their perception of Sweden, and most of them for the worse, according to a recent study.

data.title: Biden: New Coronavirus Variants Spread in US, Number of Cases Up
data.description: WASHINGTON (Sputnik) - US President Joe Biden on Tuesday warned that new types of the novel coronavirus are spreading across the United States and that the number of people testing positive is again increasing.

data.title: Global Military Spending Surge Despite Worldwide Coronavirus Related Crisis
data.description: Experts had been predicting that military spending would decrease as the coronavirus-related crisis has damaged big and small economies. Nevertheless, some reports suggest that the pandemic is unlikely to undermine long-term strategic trends started during the past decade.

data.title: Bill Gates Criticised For Failure to Provide Equitable Distribution of Coronavirus Vaccines
data.description: The Microsoft co-founder has donated $1.8 billion to research into SARS-CoV-2 as well as to the development of vaccines against it. Part of this sum was sent to the COVAX initiative, a global vaccine alliance aimed at distributing inoculations among countries with middle and low-income.

data.title: UK to Use NHS App as Coronavirus Passport Amid CyberSecurity Concerns
data.description: Entrusting an mobile phone app with personal information of hundreds of thousands of users may have become a norm in the recent years. Converting such an app into a some sort of a Covid-19 document is a new step in Britain's way out travel paralysis, brought on by the pandemic.

data.title: Watch Belgrade Residents Hold Creative Protest Against Coronavirus Restrictions
data.description: BELGRADE (Sputnik) - A demonstration against COVID-19 restrictions was held in Serbiaâ€™s capital with local residents engaging in a circle dance around the Belgrade monument to Stefan Nemanja, the founder of the medieval Serbian state.

data.title: Fauci: Texas Invites New Coronavirus Surge By Lifting Mask Mandate
data.description: WASHINGTON (Sputnik) - Texas is inviting a new surge in coronavirus cases after the stateâ€™s authorities ended the mask mandate, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases Director Anthony Fauci said in an interview on Wednesday.

data.title: Amsterdam Police Use Water Canons to Disperse Protest Against Coronavirus Measures
data.description: AMSTERDAM (Sputnik) - Dutch police used water canons to disperse people, who gathered in Amsterdam on Saturday to protest the coronavirus measures, a Sputnik correspondent reported.

data.title: Coronavirus Likely â€˜Escapedâ€™ From Wuhan Lab, Ex-CDC Chief Claims
data.description: The WHO is due to release its report summarising the current findings on the origins of the highly-contagious COVID-19 coronavirus virus which has killed over 2,750,000 people around the world and infected and sickened another 125 million.

data.title: Not Enough Jabs? Indian State Governments to Float Global Tender for Coronavirus Vaccines
data.description: According to India's federal Health Ministry, it has provided 180 million COVID vaccine doses to the states and union territories for free, and has nine million more doses in stock. Only 2.7 percent of India's 1.3 billion population has received both doses of a COVID-19 vaccine so far.

data.title: Google Says Took Down Nearly 100Mln Coronavirus Ad Scams in 2020
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Out of 3.1 billion "bad ad"' removed from Google in 2020 due to company policy violations, over 99 million were related to COVID-19 scams, revealed the latest Ads Safety Report published by Google on Wednesday.

data.title: France's Le Pen Against Macron's Toughened Strategy to Tackle Coronavirus Pandemic
data.description: PARIS (Sputnik) - Marine Le Pen, the leader of France's right-wing National Rally party on Thursday spoke against a new set of COVID-19-related measures across France announced by President Emmanuel Macron a day earlier.

data.title: Bodies of Hundreds of Coronavirus Victims Still in Refrigerated Trucks at NYC Temporary Morgue
data.description: New York City, severely hit by the novel coronavirus disease, earlier dealt with high numbers of the bodies of COVID-19 victims, many of which have not yet been buried. Authorities were forced to create an emergency refrigerated morgue in Brooklyn, to store hundreds of corpses.

data.title: Fauci Says Real Coronavirus Death Toll in US Could Be as High as 900,000
data.description: WASHINGTON (Sputnik) - US top infectious disease expert Dr. Anthony Fauci suggested that the United States has a far greater number of coronavirus deaths than the officially reported figures.

data.title: Namibia Becomes 50th Country to Approve Russian Coronavirus Vaccine Sputnik V
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Namibia became the 50th country to authorise the Russian coronavirus vaccine Sputnik V, the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) said on Thursday.

data.title: Americans Back Biden's Coronavirus Policy, Dislike Immigration Stance, Poll Shows
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Seventy-five percent of Americans support President Joe Biden's coronavirus vaccination policy and nearly as many approve of his general coronavirus stance, but, at the same time, 57 percent are unhappy about his immigration policy, an ABC/Ipsos poll showed Sunday.

data.title: Putin Has No Side Effects 10 Days After Vaccination Against Coronavirus
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Russian President Vladimir Putin has no side effects 10 days after the first injection of a two-component Russian vaccine against the coronavirus, Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov told Sputnik on Friday.

data.title: Angola Approves Use of Russian Single-Dose Coronavirus Vaccine Sputnik Light
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Angola registered Russian single-dose coronavirus vaccine Sputnik Light, the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF) said on Wednesday.

data.title: Police Use Tear Gas at Marseille Carnival That Violates Coronavirus Restrictions - Reports
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Police used tear gas to disperse participants in an unauthorized carnival in the French port city of Marseille, local media report.

data.title: Argentina: curfew extended, on-site schooling banned in AMBA amid coronavirus second wave
data.description: Argentine President Alberto FernÃ¡ndez Wednesday announced further restrictions for the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area (AMBA) in a manoeuvre to curb the so-called second wave of the covid-19 disease.

data.title: US History; Scottish Election; Oscars; European Super League; and All About Coronavirus
data.description: Join George Galloway for the Mother of All Talk Shows - this week we talk about US politics, Scottish election, European Super League, Oscars nominations, and all about Covid-19 and vaccines.

data.title: BioNTech Founders Suggest Coronavirus Will Continue to Spread Across the Globe Through Mid-2022
data.description: Earlier, epidemiologists had suggested that collective immunity would take much longer to reach than initially expected, as different regions throughout the globe experience different vaccination progress due to limited production and collateral delivery delays.

data.title: Russia's Gamaleya Institute to Test Sputnik V's Effectiveness Against Indian Coronavirus Strain
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - Russia's Gamaleya research institute has received a sample of the Indian strain of the coronavirus and plans to test the Sputnik V vaccine's effectiveness against this variant of the virus. The results are expected to be available by the end of the next week, institute director Alexander Gintsburg told Sputnik on Thursday.

data.title: Sputnik V Protects Against UK Coronavirus Variant, Research on Other Variants Ongoing
data.description: MOSCOW (Sputnik) - The Russian-developed Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine protects against UK coronavirus variant, and the research on protection against other variants may be available within a week, Alexander Gintsburg, the head of the Gamaleya research institute, said on Tuesday.

data.title: AstraZeneca Coronavirus Vaccine Does Not Cause Blood Clots, UKâ€™s Health Regulator Announces
data.description: AstraZeneca Coronavirus Vaccine Does Not Cause Blood Clots, UKâ€™s Health Regulator Announces

data.title: Indiaâ€™s Stock Markets Nosedive as Investors Take Fright At Double Mutant Variant Coronavirus
data.description: India's health ministry said it has identified a new double mutant variant of the coronavirus across half the country's states as well as many other strains or variants of concern. However, the ministry is not sure whether these new variants are directly linked with the rapid increase in COVID-19 cases in states such as Maharashtra.

data.title: Indians Flock to Sikh Temple in Ghaziabad to Receive Oxygen Masks Amid Coronavirus Crisis
data.description: At the moment, the total number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in India has surpassed 20 million, while at least 218,000 people have passed away due to the virus.

data.title: Syrian Envoy Refutes Reports That Assad Was Taken to Moscow for Treatment After Catching Coronavirus
data.description: Syrian Envoy Refutes Reports That Assad Was Taken to Moscow for Treatment After Catching Coronavirus

data.title: Sputnik V Vaccine Protects Against South African Coronavirus Strain, Developer Says
data.description: Sputnik V Vaccine Protects Against South African Coronavirus Strain, Developer Says

data.title: Anti-Lockdown Group Stages Protest in Stuttgart as Germany Braces for Third Coronavirus Wave
data.description: Stuttgart is home to the Querdenken movement that emerged last year to oppose restrictive coronavirus-related measures, which the activists view as a violation of their constitutional rights. They have carried out a number of protests, including in the capital Berlin.

data.title: Pregnant Indian Doctor Succumbs to Coronavirus, Husband Shares Heartrending Last Video Message
data.description: Dimple Chawla (Dipika), a doctor, was in the seventh month of her pregnancy when she tested positive for COVID-19 on 11 April. After suffering with the disease for more than two weeks, she lost her unborn child on 25 April before losing her own battle against the virus the very next day. She is survived by her husband and three-year-old son.
